task.title: Registering as an endpoint in IBM Universal Behavior Exchange test new title
task.shortdesc: receives all of its customer data for reporting (THIS IS MY CHANGE) from IBX Universal Behavior Exchange (UBX). To receive this data, must be registered as a subscriber endpoint in your UBX account.

context.p: Use the UBX user interface to register as an endpoint. For instructions and more information about endpoint registration, see the IBM Universal Behavior Exchange User's Guide.

step.cmd: Log in to UBX and provide the following information in the Endpoint registration wizard.

row.entry: Authorization key provided by UBX provisioning.

User name as defined by your account in IBM Silverpop Engage. The user name is typically in email address format, but it is not your email address. For example, <your_name>@<your_company>.journeyanalytics.com.
Customer ID that is associated with . The Org_id2 value is an integer, input as a string.

Two-digit number of the database instance that contains your customer record (for example, 05). requires this value because your organization ID might be included in multiple user authentication instances. names the tables and identifies customer metadata by concatenating the org_id2 value with the Pod number (for example, 1234_01).
